alert.note: Alert for Adams; Juneau (Wisconsin) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS LaCrosse (Southwestern Wisconsin, Southeastern Minnesota, and Northeast Iowa)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued September 03 at 1:53AM CDT by NWS LaCrosse
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southeastern Juneau and southeastern Adams Counties through 230 AM CDT... At 152 AM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 10 miles southeast of Adams, or 11 miles southeast of Friendship, moving east at 15 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. This storm will remain over mainly rural areas of southeastern Juneau and southeastern Adams Counties, including the following locations... County Roads B And P, Dells Timberland Campground, County Roads B And K, County Roads G And M, Lyndon Station, Stand Rock Campground, Big Spring, Highway 13 And County E, The Preston Cliffs and Yukon Trails Campground. This includes Interstate 90/94 between mile markers 78 and 86. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
